image.altText: A middle-aged white woman on-stage speaking. She is a wheelchair user

items.synopsis: There are fears in the Australian community that disability is "infecting" and interfering with the lives of non-disabled people, a disability royal commissioner has told its closing ceremony in Sydney.

title.children: Some Australians fear disability is 'infecting' lives of non-disabled people, royal commissioner says

image.altText: two men dressed in hazmat protective clothing walk with fire personnel outside a building

items.synopsis: Authorities say 30 people were evacuated from the swimming facility in Prestons near Liverpool just after 4pm, after reports that a number of people were feeling unwell.

title.children: 'Toxic cloud': Six children, four adults in hospital after exposure to chemicals at Sydney swim centre

image.altText: Carlton AFL star Patrick Cripps stands near the team dugout during a game, using a towel to wipe his bleeding nose.

items.synopsis: Melbourne star Kysaiah Pickett's finals are at risk even if the Demons advance, with the Demons forward under scrutiny for a high bump on  Carlton's Patrick Cripps. The game is in the balance at the MCG - follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: Dees star to face bump scrutiny as Blues hold narrow lead

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Pretty much exactly the game we were all hoping for. Tight, tough, impossible to call at half-time. Carlton has looked the better side for most of the game, responding to an early Melbourne blitz in the first quarter and settling into it nicely. But the Demons are still right in it, despite fairly quiet nights from some star players. The forward line is still an issue but Joel Smith is having a good night and offering a focal point. There are two points in it at the break. Plenty of twists and turns to come.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: HT: Blues take the lead and are up by two

children.content: (Getty Images)
Pretty much exactly the game we were all hoping for. Tight, tough, impossible to call at half-time.
Carlton has looked the better side for most of the game, responding to an early Melbourne blitz in the first quarter and settling into it nicely.
But the Demons are still right in it, despite fairly quiet nights from some star players. The forward line is still an issue but Joel Smith is having a good night and offering a focal point.
There are two points in it at the break. Plenty of twists and turns to come.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Good game. Good footy from both teams. Demons got the jump, kicking the first three and rocking the Blues onto the back foot in the early stages. But Carlton settled and responded through Tom De Koning, and some pretty sharp ball movement to get it up there. There are positive signs for both teams, with defences largely holding up and the midfield battle tight. More of the same will do nicely from here. (And yes, the score at the top is currently busted. We're working on it.)
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: QT: Demons lead by seven points, 3.3 (21) to 2.2 (14)

children.content: (Getty Images)
Good game. Good footy from both teams.
Demons got the jump, kicking the first three and rocking the Blues onto the back foot in the early stages.
But Carlton settled and responded through Tom De Koning, and some pretty sharp ball movement to get it up there.
There are positive signs for both teams, with defences largely holding up and the midfield battle tight. More of the same will do nicely from here.
(And yes, the score at the top is currently busted. We're working on it.)

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: No late changes. Melbourne had to shuffle the pack a little as Angus Brayshaw is out due to concussion and Jacob van Rooyen is suspended. Michael Hibberd was also omitted. In their place come Adam Tomlison, Charlie Spargo and James Jordon. A couple of forced changes for Carlton too, with Harry McKay concussed and Jack Martin suspended. Matthew Kennedy has been named, and Jesse Motlop comes into the 22 after acting as the Blues' sub last week. The subs tonight are Josh Schache for Melbourne and Oliver Hollands for Carlton. A key forward for the Dees and a runner for the Blues, interesting.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Team news is in

children.content: (AFL.com.au)
No late changes.
Melbourne had to shuffle the pack a little as Angus Brayshaw is out due to concussion and Jacob van Rooyen is suspended. Michael Hibberd was also omitted.
In their place come Adam Tomlison, Charlie Spargo and James Jordon.
A couple of forced changes for Carlton too, with Harry McKay concussed and Jack Martin suspended.
Matthew Kennedy has been named, and Jesse Motlop comes into the 22 after acting as the Blues' sub last week.
The subs tonight are Josh Schache for Melbourne and Oliver Hollands for Carlton. A key forward for the Dees and a runner for the Blues, interesting.

image.altText: A man celebrates after scoring a try in a rugby league match

items.synopsis: As the dying stages approach, the Storm and the Roosters are locked in a tense battle for NRL survival. Follow live.

title.children: Epic NRL finals finish looms as old rivals go right down to the wire

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Roosters halfback who was the hero last week could be the hero again tonight as he juuuuust gets another one-pointer to sneak over the crossbar. Roosters lead 13-12 with eight minutes left.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: SAM WALKER SLOTS ANOTHER FIELD GOAL!! Roosters lead!

children.content: The Roosters halfback who was the hero last week could be the hero again tonight as he juuuuust gets another one-pointer to sneak over the crossbar.
Roosters lead 13-12 with eight minutes left.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Sandon Smith comes off the bench and makes a sensational break through the middle, finding Victor Radley, and Cameron Munster drags him down in a try-saver. But Smith gets it again out of dummy half and, with any number of options out to the right, finds the big prop with a long ball to send him storming through a yawning gap. He scores right next to the posts and the conversion levels the scores at 12.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: LINDSAY COLLINS GOES OVER!! It's all square!

children.content: Sandon Smith comes off the bench and makes a sensational break through the middle, finding Victor Radley, and Cameron Munster drags him down in a try-saver.
But Smith gets it again out of dummy half and, with any number of options out to the right, finds the big prop with a long ball to send him storming through a yawning gap.
He scores right next to the posts and the conversion levels the scores at 12.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: What a ragged contest. Both teams look physically broken as the hooter goes. It was a half of two halves for sure. The Storm made all the running early on the back of excellent defence that denied the Roosters any sort of go-forward, but Sydney turned the tables with a few repeat sets and had Melbourne on the rack, threatening to break them open with just about every play. Both teams need to shore up their defence in their own half, because they both look vulnerable and it looks like fatigue will be a major factor in this game.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: HALF-TIME: Storm lead Roosters 10-6

children.content: (Getty)
What a ragged contest. Both teams look physically broken as the hooter goes.
It was a half of two halves for sure.

The Storm made all the running early on the back of excellent defence that denied the Roosters any sort of go-forward, but Sydney turned the tables with a few repeat sets and had Melbourne on the rack, threatening to break them open with just about every play.
Both teams need to shore up their defence in their own half, because they both look vulnerable and it looks like fatigue will be a major factor in this game.

image.altText: MInister Linda Burney during Question Time in a bright pink coat.

items.synopsis: The Indigenous Australians minister says she feels betrayed by Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's comment that First Nations people are not being affected by colonialism because "we now have running water".

title.children: Linda Burney says she was 'shocked' by Nampijinpa Price's comments on Voice debate

image.altText: Ariarne smiles softly in a selfie of her lying in bed in her silk stripped pajamas.

items.synopsis: The freestyle world record holder said she was "petrified" the discovery in her ovary could impact her "biggest dream" and chances of becoming a mother.

title.children: 'Scary time for me': Olympian Ariarne Titmus undergoes surgery to remove benign tumours

image.altText: Close up of man in suit

items.synopsis: The Russian Security Council secretary's claim comes amid a Russian man being sentenced to 12-and-a-half years jail for sending missile components to the US.

title.children: Putin ally claims Russia has 'neutralised' hundreds of foreign spies

image.altText: A coat of arms and sign saying 'Local Court' on a column outside a courthouse.

items.synopsis: A former Don Dale detainee who was recently awarded damages from the Northern Territory government has appeared in court facing "very serious allegations".

title.children: Former Don Dale inmate arrested week after winning $220K in damages

image.altText: Entrance to Dymocks bookstore in Hay Street, Perth

items.synopsis: Dymocks has confirmed that the contact details of over one million customers were obtained and shared on the dark web during last week's data breach.

title.children: Dymocks confirms details of 1.2 million customers shared on dark web

image.altText: a man wearing a cap looking at the camera

items.synopsis: Police arrested the 52-year-old at Chatswood Police Station on Tuesday night and charged him with knowingly taking part in the supply of a large commercial quantity of a prohibited drug.

title.children: Former Test cricketer Stuart MacGill charged over alleged role in 'large commercial quantity' cocaine supply

image.altText: A sign of Wilton Greens says "land now selling".

items.synopsis: China's largest private developer Country Garden invested millions buying and developing prime sites in Australia. Now, it is among several debt-laden developers selling or downsizing their portfolios.

title.children: Chinese developers entered Australia's property market with big wallets and ambitions. Now they're almost gone

image.altText: An aerial shot shows police tape running from a church to a pole and from cars parked beside the church across a street.

items.synopsis: Police say the man left his home in the Victorian city of Geelong to walk his dog at 10pm on Thursday. When the woman awoke to find the dog had returned home alone, she discovered her husband's body.

title.children: Woman discovers husband's body after dog returns home from walk without him, police say

items.synopsis: How sneaker brands charge up to 10,000 times the cost of manufacturing — and fans eat it up.

title.children: How sneaker companies get away with marking shoes up 10,000 times the cost of manufacturing

image.altText: Man lying down in stretcher near ambulances.

items.synopsis: The Department of Defence faces a single charge of breaching federal workplace health and safety laws, which carries a maximum penalty of a $1.5 million fine.

title.children: Defence faces court after soldiers mauled in Far North Queensland croc attack

image.altText: an illustration if chris dawson while he sits inside a courtroom

items.synopsis: The judge said the former Sydney school teacher used a degree of manipulation and exploitation to breach the girl's trust in the 1980s.

title.children: Chris Dawson jailed for unlawful sexual activity with schoolgirl

image.altText: A photo of a Qantas plane flying in the sky.

items.synopsis: Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney airports are bracing themselves to be busier than usual these school holidays.

title.children: Airports nationwide prepare for influx of passengers during school holiday rush

image.altText: A person in medical glasses holds up a test tube with the words "monkeypox virus" on it.

items.synopsis: China plans to manage mpox, formerly know as monkeypox, in the same way it handles infectious diseases such as COVID-19 after detecting around 500 cases of the viral infection in August.

title.children: China to manage mpox as disease on par with COVID-19

image.altText: A young blonde woman looks into the camera, it is a tight shot of her face.

items.synopsis: Ricardo Barbaro is found guilty of the murder of mother-of-one Ellie Price, who was found stabbed to death in her South Melbourne unit in 2020.

title.children: Melbourne man found guilty of murder of mother-of-one Ellie Price

image.altText: Irish tourist

items.synopsis: An Irish tourist has been filmed climbing on top of a lion statue outside the Brussels stock exchange and damaging it as he tried to dismount.

title.children: 'Very sad this has happened': Video shows Irish tourist damaging newly renovated statue in Belgium

image.altText: Missing woman Tina Greer smiles as she gives a 'peace' sign with her hand in a park.

items.synopsis: A Gold Coast woman, now presumed to be dead, was not spoken to by police after allegations her abusive partner had held a gun to her head, an inquest hears.

title.children: Years before her disappearance, Tina Greer was found 'black and blue' but police didn't investigate

image.altText: A woman in a white jumpsuit holds a flaming torch as water falls from a large cauldron above her head

items.synopsis: Some 23 years ago Cathy Freeman lit the 2000 Sydney Olympics flame at Sydney Olympic Park, where she now has a grandstand named after her.

title.children: 'I did not see this day coming': Cathy Freeman honoured with Olympic grandstand named after her

image.altText: A Kangaroos AFLW player runs clear in the middle of the ground as she drops the ball to kick it as a defender trails.

items.synopsis: The Kangaroos run down Geelong at Kardinia Park to keep their unbeaten record intact.

title.children: Kangaroos stage second-half comeback to beat Cats at Kardinia Park and stay top of AFLW

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie walks with other men alongside him.

items.synopsis: Jake Barrett, 29, previously told the court an alarm distracted him before he ran a red light and his truck hit two cars, killing one man and seriously injuring another on the Barton Highway in September 2021.

title.children: Truck driver who ran red light causing fatal Canberra crash sentenced to four years in jail

image.altText: Bob Hawke

items.synopsis: Bob Hawke returned from the remote Northern Territory in 1988 to a divided, partisan parliament. Some say this sank the prospect of a treaty before the idea ever got off the ground.

title.children: In 1988, prime minister Bob Hawke promised a treaty with Aboriginal people. Why did it fail?

image.altText: A police mug shot of a young Indigenous man

items.synopsis: A Kununurra magistrate has handed Leonardo Gore a jail term of three years and one month after a dangerous and alcohol-fuelled crime spree, which involved a ram raid, stolen cars and police chases.

title.children: Kimberley man jailed for crime spree while on bail over police car ramming

image.altText: The view from a helicopter of a stricken yacht at the base of a cliff.

items.synopsis: The NSW man was treated for minor injuries after being found exhausted in his stricken craft by one of the island's owners.

title.children: Lone sailor, 70, winched to safety after yacht slams into 65m cliffs at Flinders Island

image.altText: A statue of a crowned woman holding the scales of justice.

items.synopsis: The 63-year-old member of the Stolen Generations pleaded guilty to forgery after falsely ordering the removal of six children from two families in 2020. The court heard the children remain separated from their families.

title.children: No jail for Indigenous woman who posed as a magistrate to remove kids from families

image.altText: Danny and Jessica sitting on the couch at home.

items.synopsis: The premier asks the attorney-general to review WA's parole system, in the wake of recent incidents involving violent offenders on parole who allegedly went on to reoffend.

title.children: Parole review ordered after release of Danny Hodgson's attacker and man who killed ex-partner

image.altText: Two vehicles smashed on a road outside a school in Nambour.

items.synopsis: Police say a car involved in a crash that killed a woman on the Sunshine Coast this morning had been stolen at gunpoint.

title.children: Police say Mercedes carjacked at gunpoint before fatal Nambour crash

image.altText: Sign outside of Dhulwa mental health facility.

items.synopsis: The ACT Coroner is investigating the death of a man who attacked three people with a meat cleaver after he died in custody at Dhulwa Mental Health Unit in Canberra.

title.children: Man who attacked housemates with meat cleaver dies in custody at Canberra mental health unit

image.altText: A composite of two satellite images before and after flooding in Derna

items.synopsis: Satellite images reveal the extent of destruction in the Libyan coastal city of Derna after two dams broke, unleashing a torrent of stormwater on the densely-built city centre.

title.children: A broken dam unleashes a 7-metre wave on Derna. Survivors are left in the rubble

items.synopsis: The 10-year-old's mother is being supported by specialist officers as her relatives wait to face a magistrate's court.

title.children: Father, stepmother and uncle of 10yo Sara Sharif charged with UK murder

image.altText: A cabinet neatly showcases a variety of blue and orange mugs, bowls, plates, glassware and vases.

items.synopsis: It's one of those small things that causes big arguments in a household — should cups, mugs and glasses be stored rim up or rim down?

title.children: Rim up or down: Does it matter how you store your glasses and cups?
